Merge pull request #891 from thgreasi/husky-lint-staged

Bump husky & lint-staged versions

Author: Thodoris Greasidis
Message:
Bump husky & lint-staged versions

Also moved their configuration out of the package.json (following the single responsibility principle), which makes the package.json cleaner imo & is also what husky & lint-staged do in their own repos.

See: https://github.com/typicode/husky#upgrading-from-014
See: https://github.com/okonet/lint-staged#lintstagedrc-example

Author: Thodoris Greasidis
Message:
Merge pull request #890 from thgreasi/drop-pakcage-lock

chore: Drop the package-lock

Author: Thodoris Greasidis
Message:
chore: Drop the package-lock

Using package-lock.json in libraries is considered a bad practice since it isn't included in the published package. As a result the code that we run on our ci might end up not being the same as the code that a fresh npm install will be using. This currently only applies for `lie`'s `immediate` dependency, but will also help us pick up the latest bugfixes from our dev dependencies and possibly get rid of the GitHub security warning for our dev dependencies.

docs(README): suggest typescript `import =` syntax

This is the suggested way since:
* localforage is a UMD module
* DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#10911 with such typings got merged
  (following the [lead of PouchDB](https://github.com/nolanlawson/pouchdb-ionic-2-typescript-demo/pull/1/files) [typings](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/pouchdb/pouchdb.d.ts))

@dsebastien plz review

Author: rromanw
Message:
Improve out-of-disk-space error handling

There is a pattern in the code that calls a function which should be
asynchronous and after that it sets up the handlers. If the function
returns before those handlers are set, the code breaks. This commit fixes
one instance in the code (namely in setItem), but are (might be) more.

There is an issue with indexedDb.open, which returns request, that has
the success and error handlers. However, this function can also fail
before the handlers are set. That is why I added check after setting
the handlers, to see, if the object isn't already in error state.

Author: S√©bastien Tisserant
Message:
Fix issue #492 (instance concurrency on same database)

Specialize the default `ready()` function by making it dependant
on the current database operations. Thus, the driver will be actually
ready when it's been initialized (default) *and* there are no pending
operations on the database (initiated by some other instances).
